intro: Tarenna hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in racemes. Tarenna hirsuta is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within the island's tropical forests.
